Funding Collective

 

VentureBeat reported on Friday <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_AqBhP0nmS73-wD25f0JM7mWChqw1tL4alUkvXp3_FT_jE0MABOlakTqbaFCNXqgcvR5EMbbNbi_ZUQqNG1SrwpYlzxgzdMozj5fvtvVFew6rkk3UyUxtbOprXCRMbtBDaDeVCvRW-P4sPQd_pl34914Iwsbwuo5ThnsQVxmXeYWA==>  that Collective, the digital ad platform and services company with a cross-screen pitch, has received a Series C round of financing to the tune of $20 million, led by Cox Media Group. An additional $30 million credit line is being provided by Comerica Bank. (An SEC June filing is here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_ASAFiOetsqgNp1IN_uptJqQE3GwwSbbwInt1LDbk4U0CgznTkyBLgvJwLmZquEie_uonfO7mqYOJA3qteDB8kK2qnjOBId2WhoAsxSGHlqTLdSMEE1Fq87Mqegycxn4-sRKeaRlQsUTFeepxnEtf-WYSBdBiJclyN6vJaZnMoBCVkiu5unC3_RXuLELMX7_KFn-Bn7MCmjfAF_-6vipYxh> ). Interesting to see Cox continue to climb aboard the Collective "train" as they put their shuttered <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_CT968hVeBZxTa_y0NGhEf0raOJsOrN1_ieNqZC5e7rH9yyhkwh9N_nTJfjUJispeOYtXzry0aNMSKC0QzZIWGdeFKY8mChh4UIwBVGoEyCihSPZy2wQonBIJ0SyRKtr2AbR_i1yodVD9ZL0FtCTwwNnIfOGnAzypx95BgxubCyVMrO1CexFZRe9AAKpjazaFJ6xZnBs3VaqgxGxedMXkW3KqhjBsqaT4X7mWcmpKyTqiZQBicSK0wL>  Adify acquisition in the distance. In March, Cox announced <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_BR-jwp9TIQcyXW8-xhoNAB5npHge0oEZg9vYihMbdMbE62hb4_HtgNbgJAjLF7s3TXHp1kRUABy0g1cJNtKsIGZhbkZq4xEW4vXG_OENPSUzrnJK94spP3cZkUH4sjlVaYhJvws7FQQDnNlSQdM7aJgTfUStcGoKMHPzEh38WC4fE_0cT47WAVKFQRIwi8ejEXnxJzCO8dJdemg78JDC0ZRGDUktCDJDYU9ex5EGVMmQ==>  Collective would provide its TV reps with digital ad products and services. In May, Collective CEO Joe Apprendi said an IPO <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_D05yWcc6ClyWMnGzKlUuy6I6JR2EyGhRi4R7B3u2UhWBX6nX3awN1lg7jPFQ9zMv5Y4SfvHHvDDO5UnTbKRYbPpV4pKVsDxi-a8dFdr2LjV6RVyB9Ja51eygg0d8UZIxdXPOAeFcVaSVjG52QT0pGHLVaRd80a7b-7ztvZlI7l6Xuu81HBOfoV8OLYTqzj6pbABneFJ6g3Mc_BVieE8s4y>  was possible. 

 

Targeting Retargeting

 

In an article about retargeting, US News compares the siren sounds of in-store music and merchandising to cookies, display ads and electronic commerce. Monetate COO John Healy admits that retailers need to strive to "be helpful, not creepy." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_DZSRthZRe7yTMwYZIudEgpohMbiQn0uMHArRWE2r3h0PcrQR_wO69_oiUM4vhnMqMF-3g55Si9JuaZvHA9kQN-lg78la5PEUfTCB7u7yycjcpvsZ3BR-pFSUl7I-Ferh4VIJQN4zzQxSq9PmKOdj3GFcyFpPsGMEMB048FvixtGUiSLPID6lBTvKJ2SySsMCYJPpO15_vPG0ppkIweCN4LVWIG-bHz9MtmD-CBW1hw_g==> . Meanwhile on ClickZ, Vizury's Parth Mukherjee provides a quick refresher on what makes retargeting successful -- from a marketer's POV. Read that one. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_BOU_JyRFLS83DB0SCUEtTiuohiQx2WMTdj25q7hvpBBBPusbL9BpLVdkcqV9HHTKb1gomop64Cad0pJookfalrAq_sH7Fo4Tn18tiYYvirtYydBcSYx4a3SPXgI1sK1Vzpjd89HvmQc8aMHRHN49LDY4cAJET-cODNtVQHu7ow-hBTsBI6e5GXGpR1YKL8bl0=> 

 

Yahoo's Soft Display

 

Yahoo will report its Q2 earnings Tuesday <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_ADVUoqErFC3zK-CNmPJaNVJ-4MgUgRvI61JVACNTLJktyHaLfc8XBkR5HuraQ4qI2DM9ySeNBvqwt6EN8xoy-g1EOvGM40sljfVvfB1Zz4p_ookUU8uWdXZYEJW2BuAVxzRDJ_Yqcha6n_CGewYJdxaV_IzRg0jsXmSIGsDp5NeXfkXoKdi3Md>  after the stock market closes. JP Morgan analyst Doug Anmuth says -- in Wall Street staccato -- that he is "expecting Search growth but Display likely still soft. (...) We expect Display to remain soft as Yahoo!'s sales restructuring could take time to ramp, competition is increasing and the company has reduced some inventory on the homepage and in email. Demonetization, however, could help engagement and ultimately increase pricing as remaining ads generate more interactions and click-throughs. We project slight Display growth in the back half of 2013. We are forecasting 2Q Search net revenue of $405M (+5.0% Y/Y) and Display net revenue of $418M (-11.7% Y/Y)." On Sunday, The Financial Times also reviewed Yahoo and its CEO, Marissa Mayer, pre-earnings release. Read  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_AvpzRvRZNNsGXjAfms5RP-KgwDx8qMJ-S--arRW4C73iZ9q-mSgUJdk_LUY0ZFYWGvr0VmS8F9NOtyltnMmRY3oMNQE5UOi553MmNhUSPEgUSLKL4pT90EwQ91dhqsvDGVIYyLtSrCmBoCdqZqzUpAh4XRhrkDXCLZD-eMVTvkO0Xilspr0oCy> "Mayer still waiting for her Yahoo moment" (subscription).

 

RTB Momentum

 

Sell-Side Platform (SSP) Rubicon Project tells MediaPost that, according its own marketplace app (get it in Apple's app store <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_Atc5HcKTn-4fFlmJUGOW6Ot9XrAIKtxC5hB3No7CqtQymSnYczivPyM7CxIFleGqEVOtTsl-PSIZUIozvNAOPwU1xZ2aaRbwcsOCw04ys8irW-O-D6I3t86rw9YRi3t5QAQ8pHIgdGHPhTif9Pc9UEzSdCSnlXIrEXgX1GQ1PCZsCYYdjO675w> ), "The U.S. had a 1% drop in spend and a 3% drop in impressions last month (compared to May). The global market didn't fare much better, with a 1% increase in spend but a 1% decrease in impressions." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_Cvvnk_Vb5rW7ixGGMlb2uoABmIiXFlg5OD6MSGrf8tOCzISL5BUuMumA_gTCXXlel_5tNi0z25FQ5C0C5U-58yVIg4r-nGtBkkk44sMyXQq4o_OZyes1GuRwgsOm_EI7hPkF69TFeRTzNiU8hv3VJ1d6bg2gUietAgbt41AsIUBOKR8db4k9eEjrhFNrkrYXXml62m41WVZeDebB2rzu5Kr5KWlKAn8VE=> . Given the source of the data, it would seem this could also be seen as an insight on the SSP's revenue momentum?

 

Video Ads Interacting

 

Video editing and ad optimization continue to get closer together as Adap.tv announced a partnership with Brainient. M&M Global says Aegis' AMNET trading desk is using the new capabilities through Adap.tv's App Center: "Brainient's applications include the Microsite facility, which allows users to open within the video to see image and video galleries, fill in contact forms or interact with social buttons, and the Product Carousel that allows viewers to shop items that appear in the video." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_A0PtdIwFCwh7QTSHdycH2zq-Fu8m3EbC34HeyRNYKCvZdIpPEALpy9cGu4nNm_Iixan_rG5e4bozi2qc1n5T2nk6A4cYQ9lrpr4smfBuJ8wAp8mnMXc7dBMXIjiwh5tCnVaP0dh4GgBiDUZxx08HO8x_wTYBr0_5gfx_8C50V7sbxHnvi7DfDk-dHolfLYYLQ=>  And read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_BuTZH8LQ-pj9c7MBqmw0SYaKjS1N9g1ilCwYUY2IJc3FDwBhWhlLb0IL39K67160_RJzDuJz2bF-jqFfdlnXLWyC5ZQ8WgLXjyicmX99C1gonsz4PJZoul-BPFOqsTcPA=> .

Google Like Amazon

 

Google will report its Q2 earnings on Thursday <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_BbH02diYEqiNNtQYS2DThnqoXU3we21rlSar4g3a1xxLp4fiXm0G12wvG9U4x-ZrXare4uJVqS1odNA0JgaZhzSw0rgScGU7A3fsv6cenftyjBI07ovl3sXH4nElOjnnt8LvVaxb967QTR9gb4Z4_f>  as the company's e-commerce display ads -- known as Product Listing Ads (PLAs) -- will get the microscope treatment from Wall Street. Jefferies analyst Brian Pitz reveals some pre-earnings research in a note to clients: "The top three PLA advertisers were digital marketing companies (running ads for third-party retail clients), with Kenshoo again taking No. 1 spot. eBay (No. 5) remains a top PLA advertiser after being mostly absent from our checks in 2012. Walmart (No. 4), Macy's (No. 8), Amazon (No. 11) and Home Depot (No. 13) also remain top PLA advertisers. Top verticals include Clothing & Shoes, Home & Garden and Beauty & Personal Care. Google continues to innovate and refine the PLA format. With rich product information embedded directly in the search results, PLAs make Google appear more like Amazon."

 

DNT's Certain Things

 

In Ad Age, Kate Kaye explains that the W3C working group, which has been trying to come to a compromise on Do Not Track standards, has received a new proposal from ad-industry members. Kaye writes, "The proposal would alter the way analytics firms, marketers and others that track Web surfers would have to react when they encounter a Do Not Track signal, letting them continue collecting and using behavioral data. In exchange, the industry would agree to strip that data of certain information it may keep otherwise." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_DvxZNHG5F64cCTHlTPExDIlr58PAAxoI_38OeVT_N-1emBsBX1gHjuskHx8BtMZEmeKkfS1NUrL26t11uCEXGynnSD0v-hk1JXu_C-aRMqICFauflIHixRVGP_PytI5VVjKb8baYSdoZq9IGlk8k9zUIk4o_gJ5_uVgy0QSObQyABsiKxXlDcKwH1X6aI_47-CwnIqJ2TIDg==> .

 

No More Hulu Rumors

 

After weeks of buyout rumors, it's official: no more rumors. As The New York Times reported over the weekend, "The three companies that mutually own Hulu -- 21st Century Fox, the Walt Disney Company and NBCUniversal -- [will] make a new investment of $750 million and use Hulu's technology to compete against other online distributors like Netflix." Read all about it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_BW30l3ngrQAnXdhS5tj7d6wtSuwYv4JvZOJ367CjEZbc4jVlqMPxQOP661_tfzM_AYLxmnj208s2Bra5RZn6puWksBSEZzFtXUhFvZT3nGznI5vg_7nkRMs7yFfRdnw8FWTofFkyXD-S3xnifumrS8Ot_s7rt4W-197EpdIerWCKOpwlUTBj63uAZ_NC5edKk-wsBAPgGImeIg0G08jnXhIFiv8ujFyOv5F38_1glGt7DR1k11euMk>  They're gonna need ALL that cash to compete with Netflix, let alone others -- especially if broadcasters and cable companies continue to migrate online. "TV Everywhere" strategies are on the march.

 

Engaging Mobile

 

Univision's president of ad sales and marketing, Keith Turner, remarked to eMarketer's Ellen Oppenheim that its Hispanic audience "are early adopters and heavy users of technology, and they are more likely to engage with mobile ads than non-Hispanics." Univision, he said, experienced 300% year-over-year growth in mobile video plays between January 2012 and January 2013. But, with such a mobile-immersed audience, he claims the greatest challenge is that many agencies and buyers "still view mobile inventory as lower value." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001RMe-x-4yR_Cssj_ZdpPG0Ng0tAtNWZ2kcJN2UcLmcGy_mfJz9yfmWHp2WS0mgIhvcVpDE0wACZDpoOKYrqXyBVcv0fKez2bO8DjeAXKkNSwT9tjZZlHkeRJ-YugWBwP-DU3Bgf1d2DrLs8I4d_IMLJl-d3DiFemonyZtNmkwGID1pCii8jMB9E17FETwB5_wal5RtnWHI8-AzJ_wpxv5cExYXO3ZhNIslmPHaerv3yw=>

Microsoft Differently

 

Microsoft has decided to re-organize itself according to a press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001bIWKR0JW8uEFgKwp2qHuAaFySNSGeH_X0pEo1fV1r6YZF5-2oh-nnJtYioH14aYhv7R0bKDPV6EYLovT7HVzorGqm_1VPjGgpttfjNAbPNMjW44l7JU7Ia7LjO_tCUjFVFYq8eU1UcDHNMxiY8_ze4LdzWvUV4bRynSGO4sbg1ZwFiP1JKBzaiIO4x7gkQk1byORa38Uh2M=> . On ZDnet, Mary Jo Foley breaks down the news, "The new Microsoft is not going to be cleaved cleanly along devices and services lines, as some had thought and heard. The new org is a little more complicated than that." Read about it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001bIWKR0JW8uHusYdfzI37SP3eKad7RaHG3HyQP8rTzPMUv79vrgx2ZYPEca-C-SHiYPsXscBr9epDZhWdxY2b6Zn7enRSJDkQjHXPBt4Fw7Jrkla9XQdN9dPUvtMCEIB3DdMulo4AB98lv47i1t9fXXfisZJPQltxCjked8SpK6hNVE8WUpfoxCwmm-7YbbQt70oJVkQnUNuJ3QqVoB4pzA==>  And read Marketing Land reporter Danny Sullivan's take here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001bIWKR0JW8uHHxhP7SCSCE1CzysTZLj7-yuC4slWdHiAeb_avtd7wG_ZJb8eNaLQ222XQ-YS8yWmpz0pQ2mymo-Zx8BNeqeJ14tw88CVDYJMOo1PcoTA9YTPh8bT7vIWAKA8qq2xmz3FIjm3bK2RGTjid706V7EdYgEC0XxIAtmU=> . Sullivan offers, "Microsoft is all about engineering, whereas Google is more product-focused, it seems. And unlike Microsoft, Google has top management positions to cover its ads and social efforts, plus 'Knowledge,' Google's fancy name for search."

 

Explaining Arb

 

On iMedia Connection, Rare Crowds CEO Eric Picard takes to the keyboard with an "explainer" on arbitrage in advertising. He begins with ad networks: "Back in the day, ad networks would go to large publishers and negotiate low price remnant buys (wholesale buys) where they'd buy raw impressions for pennies on the dollar, with the rule being that the network could only resell those impressions without identifying the publisher (blind inventory resale)." Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001bIWKR0JW8uFLtk5Irw0M7AxxEj8LTJ1ki2ZFzzK271iCzdX1LvAbfVAC8BUNNi27ZS93Vkzhn53LyHuF9aQVY-awS8ud-s6dspnTXESFKWL3uPbGTj14nvlOSSYxpBkY3wOMrDxp5kwYv7JqaGgAHnedhZirg-xQ> 

 

The Mobile POS 

 

As the lines continue to blur between in-store and online retail, 61% of large merchants have reportedly deployed "mPOS" or mobile point-of-sale technologies or have plans to do so over the next year, according to this Mobile Commerce Daily <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001bIWKR0JW8uFohXQmPqeNgi7hUbzOy7icBQpQomO20mzyQelLT34oU6YTdR88_2txluch9ywqxTBAhvbalSVGNXgT2J1ePPXDobRz3J2JXNCJy8PwgWuMRy62w8pYJnjr5odVCKaIzyEvvJC7DF47ELFiERcBakRibB8q9deXCU3EyBMQIXZ4CNnFmHjvTgcT6Cyvso3zN48hfFI82XCPcw==>  piece with statistics from research firm Yankee Group. One sporting goods merchant Moosejaw has seen 70% of in-store transactions occurring through mPOS. This can only mean one thing - the data explosion is no longer limited to the couch-commerce set. It's now reached the ranks of the store floor.

 

Guidelines For Mobile

 

Despite faster and faster growth <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001bIWKR0JW8uHESLb_3m-Di0ZZetjbn6EIl0xfFI4g-20XvrOustEGeWAwdwUauYYhXpl3eB0q2e_mdsAx-4yuN8brX0Xo_IXUB6PxzXt99NwQORQ9kv_puvLThL2hgzqzPOlZc1IevzA5rw5XQpjoHWDH8vIw3sbcWDyIrJuoAWsb2XS25OPZTDyJTtwppIntw1q1YZieRz2tcksSsQBENjtsLkwIFnPK>  for mobile advertising, the space is still plagued by issues around scale, attribution, transparency and targeting. Trying to keep pace with the mobile ad market's demands, the Interactive Advertising Bureau, the Mobile Marketing Association and the Media Ratings Council have completed joint guidelines for mobile web and app ad metrics. The mobile web ad standards haven't changed much since the last comment period, but there were five basic additions to the app measurements, including a warning that "HTML5 may impact how and when ads are counted and bears close examination by auditors." Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001bIWKR0JW8uFMArybjJhiDVBk5xf0TBv2MPCarlq_j6eWcLbwk6RBSMYtiLv6LJuaVu3gVp1GKP7ecRBqjHOB5ZX_Mul8dwGaNkpYj-cJ5gnx8eWiHvl85oLNFGvo1COcO2KQ1i5pLz_zxjJgD0AYcbFv2T5_0agXGHx66pGqiGQ8xqbhtt-qylABrNON1I9vr0uRPd1-qgp-Sc1wwb9zYfKGdTw35XEamCHO747HCZ4=> .

 

The FBX Case

 

According to an article in Adweek, Palms Casino Resort was using Quantcast's FBX buying capabilities. Adweek's Chris Heine reviews the results, "Compared to other display platforms during the test, the look-alike-targeting ads accounted for half of all bookings, and cost per acquisition was 33 percent lower than usual." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001bIWKR0JW8uEqigeicOxdHeuuvxsvhvNX0FPwnAi2olPGsajbjPxE3EbY_fxCTL3m0Vg-s_PwNyZlv-mfjbDPA3-KmxrUj7RI9fGUmJyhV5xrqxHqiekIs_aumPEgqBoBZPLohOiMYno6a8RAWrYpImBPO7gIZQubUGx2D74o0kWHdZKQK9WzplwOZVmmO-a1eb-pMNvnbUUjGRTiWjd7NJEoC7GuTujfnVFRwRAoPE5u5DeXvXDTow==>

Who We Are

 

On the Upstream Group blog, Doug Weaver says that ad tech consolidation is coming and he gives a few tips to ad tech-ers to survive it. Weaver addresses ad tech company sellers, "Throw out all those 'who we are' slides leftover from your VC pitch deck. On slide one, tell the customer what you know about them. On slide two, identify a problem you think they might have. You may think you have to first introduce your company and give them context but, again, you'd be wrong." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001bIWKR0JW8uFDCYRkU2C1Vv1t4nMd5SdX11shNSLpwT1uPgkMCjRnyq1zbZxi47AtvqZFXm-_7XyB0beQ4XfLph_RDDfRuP6CMqbcObW9rZyXrQ3snh3zVmf9iFrHNdcOg2IzzeyrQbXiluMeo61ryA==> 

 

It's Raining Content

 

Weather.com, the flagship digital outlet of The Weather Company (fka "The Weather Channel") isn't waiting around for the next "superstorm" to get a flurry of traffic to its site and mobile apps. The company is building out more specific content extensions, something Weather executives previewed at the upfront and NewFront presentations <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001bIWKR0JW8uHUtigWWnjhABatKcn8-JkLxEpX0R6IRa96i7nTvvyP-79BPP3PuYyHtQN8ack_UF5ryIxeCiUCdW8-NgEtSpphoGIw8W3MvU2LYU1XckYbrojE3V5NXsluLC-S_grdbESvCBPPX-ZxLYf8tcnAGhxq7XTHA2YHaJMoK6N5RW4ezeZY7xiO5OZ3OncWBdRpnF9VpFvK2uvkVb3ASX--T9Ii5uPRfO3hrRg=>  this past spring. "Turns out, our audience is hungry for science, nature, animals, discovery, gorgeous photography and video," Neil Katz, VP of Digital Content of Weather.com, tells Digiday's Josh Sternberg. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001bIWKR0JW8uGbCcvbHKIgrozSe6CjyLD5hTRBCuvbCoZj3JIeg28CkkeQcu5zLZWKWRMFjuLDt65RXV1nvT6o37akYElv-i2JH4Vwotqz5zN15pxpAatIBESJ5TJkX5hNcsVM2jyqWFnvYNw2WnZfE5GoI2VjSxlTfhGjYLZQx57c0TdTQzgMpr3FWRZj68WuzBXLJ1Prx0iv1Wbmos9K6A==> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrRJzZM6qtUY3AMUZcQiS9n7vnhyZ43d1LVk-HPwvKSodEdHLbXSYPaI2tQUy3aRQ_Fil5M-SxhcB-Gyok8a62I7O_9-t0nFYxFPLl1GgLSyC5PhS8Mh2TllFuk-I1shc4Y=> .

 

Out Of Beta


Joining the increasingly crowded mobile demand-side platform landscape, mobile analytics startup Apsalar has launched its new DSP platform. The mobile DSP uses first-party behavioral data from approximately 700 million mobile users to let advertisers do lookalike audience targeting. With Apsalar's help, app developer TinyCo says it saw a nearly 90% game tutorial completion rate. "We're excited to continue scaling our campaigns with Apsalar in an optimized, cost-efficient way," said TinyCo growth and user acquisition manager Adam Merber in a statement. Read the press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrRb5YYGhgmvMTXgBMDojOWXtK-7AEhUw1TN9SaHxdb7ixBlfkIwaol4kuQzbuJ4rmiCRytA0XYmdfNMM1WmPX87RxTx6qpoVpzE5Vqo_59zo9GQD4K0gkeZd-yHXr2E28Na71diDxSSSfDhIz4SQWTcBelWDMqctjZZQ2RycrL3jWcZu91Zx9D46FmAa4Uu6dAXg0J5A0MhfX28g2c6jjOM2n3tRFa_4avdDFTtVYeI4RarmHKxSGATl7bSXDG0K45MIRy4oCgz4g==> . 

 

A Native Warning


Native advertising may be hot, but overdoing it could lead to regulation, writes AdWeek's Katy Bachman. "Certainly, the search engine guidance should serve as an early warning to the industry that at some point in the future, unless the industry self-regulates, the FTC may be knocking on their door," Linda Goldstein, who handles advertising law for the firm Manatt, Phelps & Phillips, tells Bachman. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrS9c1nEkbWrP-XpL9TSQ4PbLf2n26X3GWccNCU8qVAfLq6-I8MXhk-0Ytk-CYOCCu3GvPguCDRrCxlvj_5KGyIvHODR5STQRJPfUDG7jAsmLdsJSpfrZU_fBZfkuv9UlMtrowc66VXYeAIxxH0kXdq3HcTnHQtmDqCSY7sjWxkvZ_ACrIkOdnvRUMLVUXKD08J067b8Y_EUc26golmHWP9u6KDu193tPUVResaQB7hBpw==> 

 

Badge Of Honor

 

Ampush (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrT3GFH4OgI6lfk6BEtCAH17DgYn3qtBAf17QBve009svBa4J5XF0dcpb6tenH76DiZlKf-_T2iXgJu_lzKUq22xEe1hwWTnk4gz9sOpt-JmhXK7OKsgAXB0Zakog8NIVUWHmFR7Qnn9wSB-QUQ-_TSu> &A from Sept. 2012) says it has received the coveted Strategic Preferred Marketing Developer (sPMD) designation from Facebook, which only 14 other companies have received. Read more on the Ampush blog <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrSh4h8UCExtsOFVsmHCz2wqwl3U6UhUcSJCk6rjR_W464IgCcydz3vCyvuTQeGJlJgjU6hSE2VCpMn2B7zzAncwTi4WK0sSCkRFkgvLt8KjtPF5dfwW65TfejFgvl7ho_22nCRFy66SfBvw_-yg4JJzPg4VWZJEFbhtJxLEvD8KOw==> . Laurie Dewan, VP of Monetization at Rdio, provides the client voice in the press release (PDF) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrRBTpcuarf26o7alQrZ0zEwJyxcQ9v2iM4rqnyMxZ3hVv37WfdcupiQNJoqRV3BQPnRPDstKllKsw69yKU1gbA8eq-zvg3mPwm1mIJAijxLp39z7Ek8OIE5lTEcBpBcwWYbCNuqK9MB3UEo_SudqwTQFR6xStvnE7-o7tX18PfqjG7mGcoSJBhaXuCl-QGmRPA=> : "By leveraging their [Ampush's] AMP 2.0 Social Marketing Platform alongside expert insights and a focus on mobile, Ampush helped us optimize our campaigns to keep CPIs (Cost Per Installs) attractive over time, while scaling our paid media on Facebook internationally."


Video Pipes

 

Datacenter provider Equinix and BrightRoll have teamed to help RocketFuel with RTB video ad targeting, says a release. Equinix is a bit of a black box (perhaps literally) but explains its media offering as follows: "The Equinix Ad-IX ecosystem enables efficiencies in the digital advertising market, which is evolving from traditional ad purchasing to include ad exchanges that help buyers match inventory to viewers in real-time." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrSZoEQLhiFoPTSR5_Ny2F4NWULtziwoH7PuVqe6ju1ih4N_rpo4an2MR3sn1U9ln7RmBBkEkO57-T2H6bVx82q3aNh8wZCZYBqc9VmUQEMUiOtY51Ax-G-egj2zhsdtAVq86ytZSDdsWaqx3QcNnZL__j3JvCRBWMYtlj8CqVS1Ywm_CUQUTua00GhRUI9-o-NtMkWHE2LsU0a4SjBt3HOTPUHVqs8amkLQJeveXvKhu4P30cMqzYmgquK53HiU-71rBppFE1GK0Q==>  Oh, the pipes.

 

iPad Ads Surge

 

As print ad dollars continue to stall, magazines are seeing gains in their iPad ad sales and units during the first six months of the year, according to the Publishers Information Bureau and WPP's Kantar Media. A collective look at the 58 titles covered by the PIB's report, the number iPad ad units was up 7% in the first half of 2013, compared to the same period in 2012. At the same time, iPad ad units jumped 24.5%, while print ad pages showed a slight drop of 1%. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrQBy4nxcAka2qnVYVYu6mkjN0nuiN4A3IaDxauSLspGxKoRQw7H2Xdqth6CqKqIkoriJz6fj0NhGr3VJAd9V7Mywp1mAU9HYZwCVMGvqJRJK7nkRcPXK9sI_dzEOFRUiLvMPxr-DVtTx5GfCheqCV27_p2uNHnruDVLEBwcxIVoplE0uFE16IcynC9U8KzNNYRyDpOqC1NvY4Ae2qRADMR2Tm1X5kfDoJal8MYKuI0SqYQskYLiu2cMGKlpdW92NQs=> .

Facebook Arbitrage


On Business Insider, Jim Edwards reports that Facebook is requiring pricing transparency - or banning arbitrage of its ad inventory. He says the new policy "is buried in Facebook's 'platform policies <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrRmRXxf7mRBo1f62WeltpTTbvVI8MZMZuYkxy_3tkONc2TBMX2ld7oNuni3nCfR-oHTbtfu_5u5thjqfidg5L49prMmSK9vTAR2GnUWid-LwWlxQEPrX0KONnvrUXaTFAs=> ' for marketing vendors who plug into Facebook's Ads API to buy ads within the social network." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrQ739jr3BeQ8T-V0NYa9pwDiut-BAX5ZviD0cwtvb1vjRizL24RpVdAxDNQ7olp-QJDi5HlWFttJOnZj79-PJoPgE19dbZmRhZ31V0sYbC8qZtPPLzC-N1QK0Y-gPWe-wZssvZM2NrnSl0I_qNs9YqYVGz3TI6QZGHGHtmCtvY37-vqgUpWtgh9> 


Post-PC Days?

 

The last few years have seen a steady decline in both sales and attention for desktop computers in favor of ever-smarter smartphones and tablets. ZDNet's Adrian Kingsley-Hughes points out that the mobile marketplace isn't looking so great either, primarily due to over-saturation. As evidence of this, he points to a downgrade of mobile phone maker Qualcomm. "The high-end is where the money is at, and if some analysts are already saying that this space is saturated, then the potential to pull in profits could be prematurely curtailed," Kingsley-Hughes writes. Could this situation have negative portents for the growing <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrQXXNqK7GWFaiyPG_5tj29n7fH7DkYqSNNX-5gHG6ycpySlIyjDySabeDWi73Dy6ics9sRGRPCLifTjLY8yLxrYUoFha65puMTzNPhzOabSR8YI8e34lYe5Tyu6O138PBDsjlj9gDQs7APfRsKRe72cKvtgVQbLMWGXCLvlGn8WP69pRx_RmuxOEs8NuUQz7eSrjDazt-ZpcPFGJR0jy3jn>  mobile ad space? Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrTEKrnsZWc9oZ4CTmlzvELMGSemBhi_V7gILQ_kseeLSSDCCa-cDAqYFHJJlZEpu2l6yhSYs86dRYhbF21AEsxQzgZZ3aF4mHkde3x6LAc2O7y9n2aSaN3IuBoULrDstmw2ncM3ObsZCkYdvujUX98wbIplsp6TVcgRM37n-kYjw7t5oKlh2LmhmtrQLlXHMSjR3L4BZNGAyQ==> .

 

Publicis Goes To China

 

Uncork the bubbly! Net@lk, a Chinese services provider that orchestrates social influence marketing campaigns on behalf of clients like Coca Cola and Pernod Ricard, has been acquired by Publicis Groupe. With 350 people in over six cities, Net@alk is broken down into four business units spanning social content, monitoring, research, and analytics. Here's more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrSUez7iWS3Yj0QZgavzSX_k5tLc4k23jsj1EhMWoOU5e5YVSDj38OhSx8yZJ2L8880nPpYK4k66WKYTCTNhI9LzPNVAMnCqcflffX6jSIHYSfZju15XH-REMkq7rJkwEVHmvX7uIR0dSJL_RADm2hfYKtj92R0-YT5EqI_e6aasX18ZKXFttu_3RD-bLibM_pOEwo-9shUiB-vP-5Xi4Wj0QhnDX3XnWuqRW4P4zb52tkgk_SYtd5cC>  from MediaPost.

 

Standardizing Ecommerce Data

 

Tech companies and ecommerce operators align. Names like IBM, Google, Best Buy, Adobe, and Qubit are rallying together under the auspices of a unified W3C project, a data standard for product and customer information called "Customer Experience Digital Data Acquisition," writes GigaOM's <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrRpM7kRkVypuNePMu9PIGBicorhFJc2fuZykTav26WFSCaRtFdorvB67OcXTe-Q815jyr_-x_AIEXg-X2MB6dOyWTsgE_pa1HRmJXp_I-qrLv8cRv6v8Fu3DfFnkRDEoPKj50LDjg0Xu_vyuKqlUUf1IVz77QfwKeyKrwNh6F8JOEsFusIkgdJ2_VMeDTVu7v85sWemyaEYH3Qop22Y_HkJdWZD9SKbzFw=>  David Meyer. The goal? "Simplify the exchange of data between Web services that deal in product and customer information (think tracking) and theoretically cut down on site technology vendor lock-in." Let freedom ring?

 

Getting Offline Segments

 

Mobile DSP Adelphic is plugging into offline segments courtesy of Neustar's AdAdvisor data arm. The companies say it's the first time Neustar has done a partnership to push its 12,000 segments into a mobile RTB environment. Press release. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrSDlNOVxm0Ms3n1N1K7JlP85uTE1j73PFKGMRqsIeuEmIwjPHE9bEA1dFKkPYDJfUR5Y-UTyIN2y9fKhnnlrFB4E6GksGnpgS7X5kuMvACetXoMVB9EB65jT7vYBGIRXXUojLXyeV5syeHsSyxRCt1lztf8rT_7LK0=> 

 

In The Beginning

 

In a tell-all (or almost) interview on Mixergy, CEO Are Traasdahl of cross-device targeting platform TapAd talks about the creation of his company. Former DoubleClick CEO David Rosenblatt was instrumental in guiding Traasdahl's early thinking. Traasdahl says, "[David Rosenblatt] is a pretty remarkable guy, so I gave him two options. Should we build a mobile exchange, (...) or should we build this cross-screen ability to re-engage with consumers, and he spent two seconds thinking and said you should build cross-screen." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001lLN32pe7VrTmk5poZHgG1BIl3PuPC7bYvKWh7QkFnkWupnDF8qZfOKR1uR5Cd6kirQQo0yjnI_EZpTmwPsb7xwBNdVx8Di8XUlRqlthTnnETO7mZvaPqNa_tdANa1q2w6BokWbzGzf3FQBDNSlTlnAK3kTYF7eTf>

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014KKr5BzoiBtCNUrln3SZH5NJSi1hpxwVK6i_4RCJaf1iPYFHJEBtdYZq1ycFfO6CjXLbGCUwN7syUsjkxuLJDl2ZI_Mcg3TetrEJ7GnnJRbtoglISpTumXJcG817ALTcWD0yKHpMi6M=> .

 

Veteran Audience

 

Blake Hall's startup began as an ID verification service to help troops get military discounts. Now its getting into other segments, such as first responders. Looking a few years out you can see implications for mass permission-based ads. PandoDaily writes, "The Holy Grail for ID.me is an online verification tool centered around the smartphone that ultimately replaces physical ID cards. That's a long way off, but Hall does harbor ambitions of becoming the universal ID verification tool for the Web." So many civilian products have come from the military -- why not audience buying? More. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014KKr5BzoiBtJz6PnYnnOQr6hKNh3GH17-uw7slEheUU8nV3Rp-cMUcPfW9MAt4v6xmJwHOHMbSv12oXjzmi_TKW0gNs0N1Xv4gGEDWsAlTJGbv1K-ao_N8s9gErIC9DZ1y4mnVuEo6R1yCuDMbjmIFjUcu0dU2fN_jf6VDjcDmnAVJIBj-klQC6dtrJebEUHrpNmcm6FrqSEWGcpgHYNXg1W3FoviFo8> 


Behavior Engineering


To sell apps, mobile companies need to tap into human psychology, reports VentureBeat's Meghan Kelly. "Behavior engineer" Nir Eyal points out that relying on visual cues won't work on a mobile device's small screen. Instead, vendors need to "create new behaviors and habits, " Eyal argues. "Companies need to design for habits, which requires an understanding of the psychology of engagement," he maintains. Unsurprisingly, companies that are good at this include Facebook and Twitter. More. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014KKr5BzoiBvQWK4LhjfqKwUMdfEVKGlyN61Txla7LjQSjnbC3Y-vQC_OAeDXDR5z5admO_9NsSH93qoVLGPquyd5cXT4c5Flm7EjEPvBjvzvzltg7fd0Fqsp0ozpiFzQ9BY_EmDbOHtJQtajM3DgQgYVCmctbLKlqZ6SFWaD1Uo=> 


FBX Vs 'Old' Exchanges


OneSixty2 founder Eric Boquet says Facebook's exchange has helped his company find 28% more users within 48 hours of a site visit and 13% more within a week, compared to traditional exchanges. But! "It doesn't mean that we've thrown out traditional exchanges all together. We're simply retargeting more effectively through campaigns that take advantage of FBX and traditional exchanges at the same time." AppNexus blog post. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014KKr5BzoiBvj2iLGnI9zdjwVYyMlhQQjr3kysTrWxROl5TURiLGh5PLItdwf_q2_jM7RPK5wFbYntca8_BfkamLsdJv7XBdNQOjIYOl9I-xz4Rg5kiWNvXXPB7yAydwzhPwd-3UpxTpesKtVMztwtqi8V6aZ6L12iUFTkJZgvOw8TFR0JNfaew3kZM0XL80wARFuKpzcAel3FYFPWRwLGMrzYEqbfAD_> 


Zip+Decisionmaker


Fresh from filing its S-1 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014KKr5BzoiBuwmepDzeXtCfHdqPrDQOUDk7MF97VdxvpTJ1G05bXFJ9VnWml6gWZ9oGBmhoOsRV7MFlJN4lZT9G0aIWDc9-CnVCVQh3N3ykKq4Jqh47Qq3H8HPfX1PWiJ6Tzq-dslcVofk3GkhLib7JT291OcSz1J__CodnErH39HY5fpXv73VhnPXdLqQIBqp6_oIIQ4VFr8Ff3mE1C9JA==>  last week in preparation for its IPO, video tech company YuMe says it can target households with customized creative ads. The company is partnering with automaker Hyundai on the launch of its Household Targeting product, which can send ads across any device to members of a single dwelling. Hyundai is particularly interested in testing out the technology for its luxury marketing campaign. "Car buying is typically a family decision, and with YuMe's Household Targeting we not only reach the decision maker, but the family influencers as well," claims David Matathia, Hyundai's director of marketing communications, in a release. Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014KKr5BzoiBseQPkt9pQy7FH7yotSZf__lgY_PbN79RNhTe_c2XGyJeLr8fZI0HsKMQXSEBtSy69B5SKf8jfQ6Esf0pW6-eyCTuL-X9cpehAsw5L-pM8LpgoqQXbs4JYCDZQIf5EdiErDVeqn7bfgkhEunXceMjEnvDiJ4LwVSZtG_4zATvByXww8IbvIaochMt5nAzP8MFYKd-zWeyKOmw==> . 



Blog Nets Under Fire

 

Are blog networks like Glam and SAY Media losing value as premium publishers develop both native ad formats and offer the kind of deeper audience segmentation through the adoption of programmatic channels? An Adweek piece by Michael Shields and Lucia Moses suggests that might be the case. Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014KKr5BzoiBv6vUTJ7tymXuLHswYAr8N2uAZZuSlc4M571YDhD6Wmp0OurkLEiPmnOxtAYEl_Bkdg9CaUMep6emcXQYFLX0q-x_1IwE64o8Q2ihTaWNHPQceeiHlCkwQ6USGxMW9QJVxpInt5P5KlROGs0CGoYNeDDxTNamyA_w0NNrMFLgFly9RyqTpRcT1yq86Ni9-kMG9j9mYgexrCc4kSCLu3cRMF> . "I think they're still fighting for share, and with more people claiming or offering native content marketing options, it's becoming a much more competitive landscape," said Adam Shlachter, svp of media, Digitas. "Size and scale of blogs, voices and personalities aren't the only deciding factors."

DSP Education


DoubleClick by Google is giving marketers and agencies a crash course in display media with its debut of DoubleClick Bid Manager eLearning and Certification. The good news? You only have to earn a score of 80% or higher to snag a certificate of completion. The DoubleClick Bid Manager Fundamentals training program intros users to the core basics of demand-side platforms (DSPs), along with "how-tos" to create media plans and campaigns, as well as performance analysis and campaign optimization. Best news? You can take the course until you're blue in the face. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014KKr5BzoiBtx2n5tD9NwpafW03LnLPyIv7IW1juThtfekzhNeyN6kEd8yP4PXeAQyQWB35DnDINnCTyvQV7Xz2PYSJRg1r2zXxmXzJNx7HDcds5h2gNBQn37aVPsrRuCxvapNvjUxTUDnzHXVCFwvJnP4uAj2Ng43820l8OvErwVHpjIXNqOMUa2rlUsDCwxHPwO1_pIuReM_WUN1weAxiLKzLGkH-6RQGWnjyfgsrdTOhV0nlsYNFeOlD3hY0BM-jgcI_p8CpLygExt0XBLZfzQd7ISgUZZbCkjd8XefyFKqHSBKg_aCHDCShQRztTfffVMqogpZP7SFz_7NWYaaRQdbSMe3QzLPtkPcLWCJ1bQ8D9jAM2qBHH5Sy-xGJnhfG3dG9WFoLaVzd-m1MdDdQ==>  Many ad tech firms have used education for lead gen.



Video Monetization


Online video platform Fullscreen is launching a set of analytics tools and apps through a Fullscreen Creator Platform to help its network of YouTube video creators and brands pump up their audience reach and monetize on content, according to this GigaOm <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014KKr5BzoiBvLs5Hw3WRSaifT6RyV-k2EslO-Jl-THFanr-UNZyS8zDjwSCyCvYGWyd8tuIWUNCs5j80QqmUjd9jbXXUbjOyiI8QtuaOsRJLxfAKk_HXNXi_I4ao7XZX46ahkGV9iSACu3umSo1pdJ9PtCqdFHbGurKZFKodC8mSU8GcODWPqIAjekGqASZMCMjREG4Q9j0qnBez-Ll802yvoRquKGjep>  article. For access to the platform, users "have to be part of Fullscreen's network, which includes people like comedian and vlogger Michael Buckley and dubstep violinist Lindsey Stirling," writes Laura Hazard Owen.


Programmatic Ascent


As programmatic buying rises, so does programmatic marketing, writes ClickZ's Julie Ginches. With $66 billion in buying spend forecasted for programmatic marketing platforms by 2016, "it's clear that programmatic marketing has moved beyond the theoretical," Ginches maintains. Expect to see programmatic marketing extending its reach into omni-channel solutions, video, premium ad inventory and more, she adds. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014KKr5BzoiBuLnWIl9x1ogKxVyPBK5FYjw7fk7sS2cJ5yD1-UBUwCCCsPz0rRMRGYEoXlmGTjcxNnbxhBvzbZUHN2CHefrJnvJpBEMsqlIj9ExIrRBVvuvQhnqZclaBK89nm0WCkD3LjtLr_OJImVU8yLYzQAJk2g_NfYkiWsBZHMv9es6i5gJvwhedi4mCVcIILMK0_Quhk=>

*	Data-Driven Thinking column... Life After The Death Of Third-Party Cookies by Eric Picard, Rare Crowds <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001wGzpX8IRChHc01tu-iHk2CMAsnMvM75irNQ0197atpvDuV6N3B_TFmpAQu3gn5dmcL_ZIdvXaQ43F6DnTDuR56g3pHVChL_i7C3vyfNblk4AghweAO77a6TxVWrDNHrTJSJ6_LHeVeDjgR5q3v9f95jbPuavBUu5-srvjObc6YaJhM2UnfmA0GpGacf7DCk3xCPfsyq_Zwxx0XgMHRgX5Q==>  "Rather than blocking third-party cookies completely, it would be fantastic if you could leave them active during each session and just blow them away at the end of each session. This would keep the market from building third-party profiles, but would keep some very convenient features intact..." (visit AdExchanger)

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001wGzpX8IRChFJ1YKT-zSNvZSGEXR8II8pBm-9PU15Aghg0Gmf5IrgEtgYjAq8inwF18McIxBYE84zoohMBwelqz0EXtsjFTaaKMOZYhb1jW4bnXUETfJvEpGJ4-KVxIwMNiyQjZ2qVTE=> .

 

Convergence Plan

 

Audio fingerprinting app Shazam has raised $40 million in a funding round from Latin American wireless carrier Movil. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001wGzpX8IRChFJ6CZUlJ9LvhJZ7aHYqmWYazhIhoR165sQNw30Fp9quVfvBLcexjfwdnoR3m8UIo6rDiWCrLrobIqJR5G2zBfRDmPS_EJGuK9Juy1EGI7kUHqxiFPFkH9B6YqPRK_I518hV89BWE3eH8DXT8H6qzG9LEFid1RW-A6xWPttsReYR52b9nAjKBb2> . But the proceeds have little to do with mobile. Instead, Shazam, which connects users' smartphones and tablets to information about ambient audio content for the purposes of "discovery," is working on building its TV-related capabilities. "Shazam's expansion into television has moved the company into an entirely new phase of growth with interactive advertising generating new sources of revenue and partnerships with broadcasters...," said Shazam CEO Rich Riley. 

 

DNT Growing Pains

 

As more Internet users send do-not-track requests, keeping up with the growing number of requests is quickly becoming too cumbersome for advertisers to handle, according to IAB general counsel Mike Zaneis. During a telephone meeting of the World Wide Web Consortium's tracking-protection group last week, Zaneis noted, "We expect DNT:1 signals to approach 50% in the short term [and advertisers] no longer want to try to distinguish between what DNT:1 signals are legitimate and which are not." A better approach, Zaneis argued, is to "deidentify" user data. It remains to be seen what deidentification would mean. Read the transcript <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001wGzpX8IRChHeYFNVAoiwlzelW38OmEzR7HoiOuYcyaUJn4AbwjOw8C2nMMeiZJYVw0_s9-2HnCFtJVF0nRCE_4fgMTKrP2lvQMn845VEQ6bHk2yCbGqVvu-KXyXEMwsf3Nuqjyk7WboR5VwaOJybjA==> . 

 

Data Literacy

 

The privacy dialog between marketers and consumers might be a little less fraught if businesses do a better job of spreading "data literacy," writes social-media strategist Ian Greenleigh in Digiday. "Data-literate consumers seek out the best return on their data," he says, adding that consumers share more of it with businesses that win their trust. As a result, "businesses get data that's more predictive, accurate, holistic and actionable than what could be captured without consumer participation." Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001wGzpX8IRChFgJ4xugmJZKllh2jt-OBINfLimQWpL3TYM_WBRJb8xh8qFUa57HARzPSzwbUtVERBdTJoos-yOx75dYRSo7J8JDOHDC60xQKnLvwX0sPcaC3BQH5RY9HfLPkIoKJdy29rl0O1gGZ7H2-r0N2_Qk9Aa> .

 

A Mobile Blind Spot

 

Mobile Commerce Daily surveys the data on mobile's impact on email performance and finds retailers are falling down on the job. "There are few retailers who haven't tried QR codes ... or looked at making their Web site more mobile-friendly," digital-marketing agency Knotice's Dave Lawson tells Lauren Johnson. "There are many, however, who haven't considered the implications of mobility on one of the most reliable performance channels for their business, which is email." More. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001wGzpX8IRChEbLoddi9_a1n3bOdnSwr5I3KkyCJCB0Pup6ohHtL_E_O2x0SVuT8S9mDZQsfL9oomZ4RuJgSPBiwjc_nRprn0PNpM6RNXpNOcWMqvkEuwYutnoV6DxeyqX2d0F3WKrLDQFZfbXtWBUiwayYld3SWxn2GEAIqzko_21Ok7oBQMWmQ3UE6CO9GySXKaYOXcv00ADcpnA_WViOg==> 


Briefing Creative 

 

In the development of a creative brief, it's vital the process become a team effort among account, media and creative teams, argues Avi Dan, founder of marketing consultancy Avidan Strategies, in a column for Forbes. "The most important job of the account planner is to put together the creative brief. This document gives the creative team all the information they need to develop a campaign. But data is not enough. The brief needs to ignite the creative process. It often doesn't." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001wGzpX8IRChH9AXrDskqa9bg4KqTbdxcte-PK-pVjpO1Y8frnydvzjXUGpoN2ts5giHbkxJ8P4JPvBoFfWKpA87m6VcTCH47QVRmrW69CGke9Kv_d7OIRxP3knNcbA2znlS9t1ogLpPORjlv7mV-ZPoCCU3yW5aCcYefbmCxN0vRTZ2dNR9TMOyyw4ixKL_kVfUFW05e7q33Ci4vO4GFkZxsC6lhj7kK4xCNiC9VZarz1rS_LROXsyA==>  OK, but what are you gonna do about that data?

Choose Your Ads

 

PandoDaily covers a new video-advertising startup based in Israel called Carambola that raised $1 million in funding. Pando's Erin Griffith explains the offering: "Carambola's ad units are basically like games that aren't completely annoying. In some ways they remind me of those pop-ups from the early 00's that ask you whether a photo of George W. Bush or Britney Spears is the president. Only for a video." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001wGzpX8IRChFs6xqBsvgH6WBezqdiDVuRasIlmsAK7Mxl0C-7PTlKqgF2vXxfuGlTwXAywvSEju1snqEBVGoQU2I2Nex3rUjgmXHAl1FiiwTcUUCyX1rrxwJAOBwhHFqHt3FUBZ7oU_cW_6Rc3OitQAER5RWRbXG-wrb8HURpo3leb7G5RkZ9wysd2nvtfQmg6pXxq1I1SFOtmk1jbNT4cpoW8qJxr-Q2DISu_XVUw8dWvbHt2lTJKA==>  Sounds like choose-your-own-adventure for video.

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001mKUX8UmG62KruXZX7Edi1eKNHwIwmCRi0rnJ0ziEtGKGdg4cg65OP8B4WK-4LTROmaMqe2qdGAoir3nrZhlw2dN2acD8yw3GijdTEWkuE4KKuac45dgEDjYoeTnGftUEEmE_JGtzWrM=> .

 

AdBlock Ad Model

 

AdBlock is the most popular Firefox add-on, as reported by Salon, but users may not be getting exactly what they expect. Apparently sites like Google can pay to be whitelisted by the company so some ads can still be seen through an "Acceptable Ads" program. Smaller companies can apply for whitelisting free of charge, but larger companies have to pay. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001mKUX8UmG62JdFKfIvpjvwl2R4nAWfRDb5liRlxKARmJ9Vp_bUWkQ-DRwCmQsk2-3dBT536kGJoI1ScU-KHZdvLETZN0kzXbPNgf2laVKYkRGUddiQegecLKzn4HowLTB6T-vizMK_ECCZp48hqiGweCdLvYlIImChicQX9uK3Fr55VDC5gJDPXO928vZJlk6zjJ9ka0rOcVHmnkZRJ6ZYzl-QgFitbPW> . 


Privacy Policies

 

According to The Next Web, UK watchdog Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) has issued an order for Google to amend its privacy policy and says the company needs to make it more clear what data is collected and how it's used. In a statement, an ICO spokesperson said, "we believe that the updated policy does not provide sufficient information to enable UK users of Google's services to understand how their data will be used across all of the company's products." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001mKUX8UmG62IFc0KolmSi6GFtcyV2dRT6OuFe2t2S5UvXDHHjFJWH57U1RQ4Qf-IHqniOk5LgZt5htg9eqCNK-J4izanImnDkqhGeyjZtL4UNtrXR6CdmcyxJh6kKr_yaupNwqavLs8bnaSzQ6FJDOW2Hh7taR_o35KkLWfsschowkp85QumrGK1BvXKNjdv3YaMIISDN61ag4U-biHVinnKOgn27MlZW3qZYJ3g1pLo-ORdBzIFcjK9EPS5Ecm-Q> .

 

Agency Data

 

According to a case study, Neo@Ogilvy claims that it processed audience-related data through Amazon Web Services at a much faster rate and significantly lower cost than its previous solution. "This raw data is an extremely valuable asset for us in order to fully understand user behavior. It has allowed us to evolve our strategic planning function fundamentally into a truly scientific process," explains Neo's EMEA analytics chief Rafael Garcia-Navarro. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001mKUX8UmG62LL42BqNKUX2lfX42ci81FVMKJua9JtD7SgDqQV5qO37MV9PF_THtkZZPksvICVBS7MBvaXNwuTIFZQJdkVVMHbelMPI-N5y8uq-zJ5iX_NjYVmWIZhybxSzaNqPbbVVhfE0SmljsXIEZO1Gh_g50VoX8fRhB3Yxh4=> .


Subscription Driving Yield

 

LinkedIn's content push may have more to do with generating engagement for the core Talent Solutions business than driving incremental ad revenue. Head of Content Products Ryan Roslanski tells PaidContent, "People come back to LinkedIn for the value proposition we offer, and the more frequently they come back, the more likely they are to subscribe to one or our premium services, or the more likely they are to update their profile." More. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001mKUX8UmG62KMz5G6A34PYVWVcS2Ojq5SniF5WwYyxoonjX2ix7m6swtqQO1DfkatW4MCVoFkiKiHv8urTPKBvcfgRXybFKQYio3S7hBjN3sOQxWMmUA1OsMfwIiRKOzW2LzvGr3D0Wzyrt1P-JSo4bLe7996iwdNBw6slZCSdtLKmmj-LPO6JI8socXhPAP5ZvxFp_IbDRBO7stn7_FNP7g_6qBT5QHUMjhk8OgbQZY=> 

 

Predictions Review

 

Federated Media CEO John Battelle review his 2013 predictions mid-year and sees the ad tech space still growing in spite of his prediction six months ago to the contrary. Also, he's waiting for Google to overtake Apple in mobile, "I predicted that Google would come out with an iPhone killer this year, so far, this hasn't happened (though many do view current Google phones as equal.) There are still six months to go, with the crucial holidays to come." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001mKUX8UmG62LzhvkPYgeHMCIr4HHw3lasScNFHpGRVuPN7kcUCrh821zp00_6e5sSGmt13Usg9sRcAslnxtg6RdGSUbvrWJTN23ue-2nNu9hzr3PEgDnoee4Ey01RZ4PjwNHkzaom9k46bIrZMHnJbnhp_CwnkkuSQfyu0BcgeRSoLmmDaQJXSkNZcxc7SslQcsvnbDvLL1X0L9DLCZ8eOg==>

Right-Rail Longevity

 

Facebook news-feed ads receive praise from marketers for effectiveness, but the right-rail ads apparently are the display-ad equivalent of the banner ad. They aren't very effective, writes Ad Age's Cotton Delo, and advertisers much prefer the successful news-feed retargeting capabilities. Optimal's Rob Leathern notes, "Before the right-hand rail would go away, Facebook would want to have something that would provide additional inventory possibilities." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0015MpjswcUYrITUMfThuGeHyP5N8Q78D2fdgusap1aBDZLyPNGanoTMjM-n-tiOwwetCmNDaH3lVctRShBesaiXKXAi6JPYqCYAGaBGeJsnwTO3xqJpHsMqLuy56gGoXJM9bbp-PM7wfho6xha-CoC95da-PZeBHR1mtDZIwuVg0W8EG1EI1DUHIihb-c4fZVxb9cNTzkX7HXWFacx7lF7i9Gl9mysdMb6> .

 

Real-Time Engagement

 

Once in a while there's a huge event like the Olympics or the Oscars, and P&G's marketing team uses those events to experiment with real-time marketing. The most recent successful campaign was for Pantene on Twitter using a #WantThatHair hashtag that brought a 120% brand lift, according to P&G's Rotha Penn in an eMarketer article. "It also drove a Promoted Tweet engagement rate of 4.7% that blew Twitter's CPG benchmark of 1.5% out of the water," Penn said. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0015MpjswcUYrKnhU5Qqt5mAa6i8g0NTxoAZCIfOZo8H-bzCn-Ya7h7yRgAh4lEyUOYGBR5rweqSg_T_SDNwh_Btrc6VjYh-GEGRCUBCWIzQlypzGKpMWwjT30dx3RLEM-_bM34nh1FhkEnd2Cki5U-8ToAzw7XdmOyJfncETHrCgQa2PHSUHNq4bM-diqoeYuoYqrTgK1IGcgWSBVy4ea0PomxPCQdyKTI> .

 

Reviewing The Retargeting

 

Facebook ads are getting scrutinized a lot lately, and this time it's coming from AllThingsD's Jason Del Ray. His focus is on the retargeting capabilities of Facebook and whether it may start to upset people to see targeted ads on the site. Facebook's Tim Rathschmidt told Del Ray, "To date, we haven't seen any meaningful impact on sentiment, and we're continuing to watch this very closely." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0015MpjswcUYrLHV5pcXF6rXGc-SQyRnU6zzlVvphFVji4i0mN_BKPBqOV_6XZwvMliRrdlMisyz3UJQGLIbwIXdWuyzd8tD8yjkXz5O6PGeqZ2YPfoBiLEB_slyC3DRsqJhi9lefVVTi5peUz5t93TlNTbCwGO-yLKW7HMi8kPCh8HmZp9GDlhf1qRt05FEbZ5> .

 

Video Drives Growth

 

Video and mobile Web browsing comprise the the bulk of mobile data traffic, and app use doesn't seem to be a huge part of data use, according to TechCrunch. "That apps number might seem low, but it's because of the way we define traffic. If a user downloads the YouTube app, we count the download in the apps traffic, but the subsequent video-streaming traffic it generates is counted in the video numbers." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0015MpjswcUYrLBpFN7PgxPq6Y4K0E6_AFvUXkVfY3OXhdbWkrWoihlVXJQpZgdBXT6XA39Gjgp5W_8ci7Lc1qWKTsArwL0u-FH7OaKvG_VhsUApTPhqsdDDlfrSlwalTslv1zX49uMlVL4WehNXTqgEg3i_v1kbcnbaljRNufDQXlPlsbnArVAhY2zq8EW00DBUZFaaT9lgI0pJfkC6_-7PqyU0-54G2skRUzYQ64heEDRtHDmI4lf81U73Fuv-5hBSweeA-y9Iu8=> .

 

Classified eBay

 

Craigslist part-owner eBay <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0015MpjswcUYrLI8U4MXKWkZETYNSC_Ocwau3KT2nBUU7ixWqamD9HBluEqxGsIRXJ2oKyGUCV8x60J81uu4F50ciAK6eyr-CjojP_z7wo0rJyWQyeODEGLPnJqPVuLgQDmi95xIpARk2c=>  is adding to its classified ads "collection" as the company acquired properties in Belgium. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0015MpjswcUYrJD9NOgpSVgpaZburh_pkZ8mYU47m3KwixXwJN6F0Fdcq9lRZKGuqRxpeooW-2SRDnldJnH01vwkAv9Cny5i20kbz2rFA_tEfwH-JUYUCKpyNq-Lh7rzX_K6hH3jeMtaLRI-ogY6A6byYSRY24XaeIP5WTKUMTQ_Vzdaomx1MGro5LcXbKX9bI-Wb5zLav5U-hBsYEw72n6aWp5uaU4U4ci6ywwXYysWdYC4rYmff4wXw==>  from the commerce giant's blog. Given the data around classified ads, it will be interesting to see if the company can devise a strategy that sheds light on "intent" and is applicable beyond the garage sale world. Hyperlocal targeting at-scale?

Independence Day For IgnitionOne

 

In 2010 Dentsu acquired Innovation Interactive, which included IgnitionOne, Netmining and 360i, but today IgnitionOne is splitting from its parent company. Through a management-led buyout, IgnitionOne and Netmining will become independent companies, according to a press release. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001E1Muy5FVDTXzOe-f3oHOR0YCQ9sM9Bc3ZZwEIE31ODTZOftmSMP7glgLFyqh0GeYgOoqC3ReaDswC_WML0cNA8U3BRFWSAorKJH9N2dvexvsl49IEEF2gts5KmXkVkbebWMZtA2ZkONUQ5LnxxcdI7KjtYDIiDzqgrhizHHoXcF4N6Lt5Cbombtt8hFBeq6y0ToKlkpIjpjZpY19lYWDDvBV8PqR-Li8SbUxqXKp96tVS2NAwWJo0et74pIecyCx> . CEO and founder Will Margiloff spoke to AdAge, saying, ""We will be able to innovate faster as an independent company. We will also be better able to compete for and retain great talent." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001E1Muy5FVDTV03faPDKKJQDjtPl3iYyoYC_FdXj2Ggqq8W79X5PeB-a3Jqmqmwcb0gBjfy9eCCD8oW616w2FOkH9vAhgP3seD_blymN2muYKsJ5UCgNEc2xg5PO1UGue050yEfFBK9fJYTaICrpDRMRhwVwxJsnx3GyOzRVepoQKcU0nSNrsn9wA0g3Pw06O3tHBsvuWJrcNavu0HCad_nw==> .

 

Amazon's Social Avoidance

 

For being a huge Internet tech company, Amazon doesn't seem interested in social thus far, as noted by Himanshu Sareen on ClickZ. He writes, "The recent purchase of social reading community Goodreads aside, Amazon has typically looked to purchase companies that have ardent customer bases and are far more 'e-commerce' than 'social.' Strategically, the company will most likely continue to aggressively push affiliate programs and continue to make itself more 'social' by allowing other entities to leverage <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001E1Muy5FVDTXtwjn_JYMW3m8FqZlzMc_HeO9D6DcvjAE6UcbQCP22B44MqJalXv91CrhMW4HlwNAZW70qBF4O_uhlOVOtWHmke0KbZb0BVLKCvpLcZ5Dkn36zo-YVe7P2udkf0RyOhEp84ztiR8SFg4MRTxcjeIpnIDK8r0Wl5Czv9zEbPw08sw==>  their user database through Amazon Login, all toward the goal of creating the most spend-friendly customer possible." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001E1Muy5FVDTVDqq4HHqUJxG1xb9XJ4iygflVXkJ5iucSGH2FlqT4ciN7FOw27qf5-DtUYQbxadnvMr8cHr1odzAhI7mK-jW7jcUqjIAQtJ2f2VgVZiVOcGSehlsp2jtDbZ4TtdmvFaSPEBfg9-iHdws3gpUOTD5W47WLkTcaM2iM-Lgs44Gspaw7icadJhgpclWxLQF2rfBC40nxUnhuou2571SiZPCSgJ6eltyA8Jaj5P5TV0OYBqw==> . And addressably friendly customers, too.

 

Bad Ads

 

Following up a post by Forbes' Paul Tassi <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001E1Muy5FVDTV0w0CD6xxzWQgKIXWiXWIRhe-2o-U6ufVlGVBf9vhLTUcf9IAX6pmD67EgPMjlrycR6aJ2hoHiyLOGAhsonkxmUTR3uMPqEUsTB3UxUJL7sOjNYvdTVxOn_C3YzGD-fYYirvG96JBRiJME9UWyAvKhbae6iSzaknH2wYkQZPLMtdvO9LlryQI_4Jb2gjfeNik2A9ZBllOp8disi0aUQx4F7Oz1ZJNgot2N_NsQ9oXp2w==> , in which he complains about the excessive amount of ads on Facebook, Robert Hof argues that the real problem is bad ads. In fact, he says, certain ads are clearly in violation of Facebook's advertising terms, but when he reached out to the company a representative told him things slip through the cracks. Furthermore, users can report ads they don't like, but it doesn't work unless there's enough volume and most people may not know that's an option. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001E1Muy5FVDTUMcmNZ3o-u4A9RZZh2ItV1oF9bv6tfik9JwJ4HuVkBLFzliHmibNbmRVJmiL32C0_JVlHqDHH37jbyBVuZ76VCG6na2FDnCppWezY_7wjiEnEr1WxdlhzEY6OkLCzo0M2nU0fscaaHB8lCpEDGEOwFp5tk2IZND5SVZClU-nBOrrHhjcGXe3omyNdxTYh8_4FwXhr03Y6Yb7jNUWhnIvY2MBhAvZJyrlV4TaLUZO52W6fmVT1rlaDrcta4gJIhvms=> .

 

DMP CRM

 

Like many, BlueKai seeks to bridge the gap between online and offline data by partnering its data-management platform (DMP) with CRM companies. According to a press release, the companies it will be working with include Datalogix, Neustar, LiveRamp, I-Behavior and others. The company claims the product, called FastRamp, "speeds up offline to online process by more than 66%." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001E1Muy5FVDTWr5p3Nk8PNUVvbrc24MJO6_ZGyVbyQsiLBa48WaA2EICG-IbeqbHCyqMlXFXRkhYhI1DypwkFNaTh3DJUBATaU5-g5KtJmiJz3WBXKMgRv2D6maLHAW5SOX9vQY8iVn34yDRI8Owx_9br_JE7IIa8Aui5AhNUBges=> .

 

Still Waiting

 

Upstream Group's Doug Weaver finds an article from 2007 demonstrating the reluctance of the advertising industry to move past the click. Fast forward to today. New measurement tools have arrived, he says, but "it's easier to be simple than it is to be right." Read what he means <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001E1Muy5FVDTXd-BpO8LDdtSJTE0uxIIzerisA0yp9YsReYUX3emnELNNPnzpQhgZeFjFoEVaE96sNbVLD4FUxC7AyFJbC8o5BG38aSPk0N8q0L8HYihcYxElyV57PN6okIaScFAMBaVtnxQJ4lTMub5VdmD4Aea8_vGhQkmG0nqw=> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jVDELiYlNWnfQvSCqbU4geExBMo2vCqXd0Cqz7O266Bi8xHVhTe221ezr0-idRmiM2GGSs4pcZua-drEHzdGJI-yBA-t3815a3i3r4OY4B-AuLVWuc4swpytGOaGzzAQEQEuYQI6LUU=> .

 

Searching For Intent

 

Yieldbot, which specializes in capturing real-time intent data through search keywords and, consequently, connects publishers with search advertiser budget, just raised $5 million, led by RRE. According to AllThingsD's Peter Kafka, "Mendez said his company is now doing a 'mid-seven figure' run rate, up from essentially zero in the last year." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jVDELiYlNWmK8LvMT0E__BvbzprK35rZAGpgHeJiFcJgR3lp92j3ojV432j6eRcU6CWrg9b2Re477KH_c5v4e1ky49nd1FyQFudFBaLrRw0pgo6h5JyWH6qp4HZThLpBPZJcvjBMC0KG1fu3dOFBsv6MerAhZ1xebjQxHd7hekNktLd3aLf2ETQ_ZnVEaM98vM7JZ1PPh93UaavNu9Rj6-vTB6nC5DnxtInO-4WkjhI=> . As Yieldbot CEO Jonathan Mendez says on his company's blog <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jVDELiYlNWnxgft7HlYg_4Onr1uSvJ_GC5SYi9xsik8A87w-ZFDiw3DCq05ISIH66J2DhIuh9FiK5vTfMgcAjP3GwSaRPe3rYnjn05G_idsDzASCzjSZh2qOlFtOD1DBx_FC71gC_GMxE4QdnwuoAA_mfmz6_3Sb>  about the funds and opportunity ahead, "It's still early days. We're travelling through uncharted territory of first-party big data mixed with real-time decisioning."

 

Gamer Intent

 

Want to advertise to gamers? YouTube is evidently a good place to reach them, says new research by the video site's owner, Google. "First, as gamers moved from researching to purchasing and playing, we discovered that they viewed brand-released and community-created videos, but relied on them at different times. Before a game came out, fans mostly watched content released by the brand, such as announce, gameplay demo and launch videos." Read the report here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jVDELiYlNWmHlNTii6yxkYl0qO2NGVPb5lQEuNzZzDbDC9y2kPYvbC-NhKqGtrT5OsfSzn-BVS4B9PjQ9QSYsjoj7j_zTmWDmTk502_tb0quNZaTQR4JSvSNw7baTQFTgG8aLKwXm3iskK9khokjmL1l2IpKVqBzTS4ZY6kzDfa07w0G9tnTaw==> .

 

Pay Me

 

In a think piece on Ad Age, Nancy Hill, CEO of the 4A's, argues against delayed payment strategies by marketers when paying their agencies. Outside of advertising, people don't accept delayed payment for services and these new schemes would severely damage the advertising ecosystem, she says. Hill adds, "The actions of these advertisers are not brave but greedy, and the naked self-interest involved is not only far-reaching but downright disgusting." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jVDELiYlNWn9DLlQ9U2f0LmIw0OaEr46-fVKy1TKY1eEYmCaJazm10p4saS_nus4ilLA48Z8GgZxMYaQ3GRpAmKV_GiwKbJYzhCgMC3YHZ8lWSmiLahC4jI6NFc9vxEoEfYggUjS6DV8pNOv-oAgngjMA6eQePL4OutqpuYrb0UhCJvme1Fe6uD4lHpupVTDJRFp_Npij65ULKqut7S9yEuaF1qJoDztRskg_vLkvjU=> .

 

RTB And Search

 

Quantcast CEO Konrad Feldman lays out some reasons for advertisers to look at real-time bidding (RTB) from a "value" perspective rather than just a "cost" one in a Marketing Land column. "What's that mean?" you ask. He thinks search advertisers have a leg up on RTB because they are used to bidding based on keywords and micro-segments of audiences. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jVDELiYlNWlOypBuTqJZc4oX4WgoUGX3TQc6hFY2gsshizu-ExRm1l3X1Xq6PQBK_HCi8lU5CIXtFGfg0YMPBn9WModI-O-rzuok6FvmmZbMVB5ickSPRJeiaFhw3RUt17bd5MZ6d8SOpMs3wdvVFHaPdaGZe1SMQuazv8hlcYdCVK9PGspOCQ==> .

 

New Zynga CEO

 

After some speculation, it's official: Former Xbox exec Don Mattrick is leaving Microsoft for troubled online gaming company Zynga, where he will be CEO. Founder Mark Pincus is stepping down as CEO, but will remain as chairman and chief product officer. "Don is unique in the game business. He can execute in multiple domains - hardware, software and network," Pincus said in his blog post. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jVDELiYlNWlxsOLP2DtrwybgwqScljsZG4TzlSmCuTESiOJLtaVVVOGJh00wUOWVQWeBuaLGEQJbC4YJFOpmmAIJfrh35nbq_-Yx5B5gYMlizbItB3uZbwqyX6xFN6NoXyvRBqPMuCdzSa1M-zMSJQ==> . And, read the Wall Street Journal coverage here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jVDELiYlNWnmm44uE2DZ5hjGNwnpqJcr3VsgvDCv2H1f0s5a2SXthHVAHzFw9h2kpthDmAuwzrF_EgNUTu25-bIoMd6mrwasFTpLpJIU-lU7y98_ljCgbxUbues9kcHhxHOZCc6F4U9LDD-P8XPIfEd0ZbagSC-wm4RYrSEUEcq4-QhcamolchW990CafRSkjwcxsH4J9NViESm1mZviSvTCUBf8dUrQ> .

Privacy Talk

 

Another chapter in the PRISM saga: The U.S. appears to have been spying in the European Union. GigaOM's David Meyer explores the advertising industry's outrage at this latest revelation by asking one question -- why? Apparently big Internet companies are lobbying in the EU and were close to having provisions in a privacy bill that would sway in their favor until a spotlight was put on the whole situation. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jVDELiYlNWk6DQ79EI5PhPdq7TtCGy8cCHX-e80uliveLtc3SpGB-9RRLoJV-esntiQA2A4hb4EoPrkTbLVNoGP8Oxovex9_9KwiRy6axRaTDONuImV5Q4LcefI8MtUP2iOh0wRwMiC18uuefX5Wr8PsD6NdaIjhFfrbRPHNtfPBKQ7xvX7zYpnwpRPI-8lLuf58NaJ0xD_kEyncWaG5lcvDkbcKpbI0dE0kiBn0wfPGj96O3GJZMCX1Yvuv0C9OmT7XgGbUn7X_58Q-Ur7p8UECvoVaaFPVApWZ1uk7NUc0laEbIJY93YjyyJBxB93JlZyiWX2dGn7BMs1iGUvYFEr5HqRdc1xFhSQugQ1QN6yIFhKCmwXa8CGQB_GmzIXu> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014Q0dZdgTDMLc50FoM3Q8tbvCGcM9J6qAlgo9QQrJFadvgGILVy0RjouY8BGVBrRjV18ZYQdKgarzJSUkke-6JrOhRvh_nk5fuqhGPpJglHOge3o6U_qHvji1Fdv1CJJ9JkHrrIkEg_Y=> .

 

Home Page Yield

 

The New York Times has done Web page takeovers, but this past Sunday it experimented with an iPad takeover, according to Mashable. The ads promoted Showtime's Ray Donovan, and featured autoplay interactive video ads. "We're confident readers will find this beautiful and well done," said Todd Haskell, the Times' group VP of advertising. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014Q0dZdgTDMJFBAAHEYAxyfujIjll4VcNsfXB8Tjl-s6l9hUfcXcEQHcYQxmnIqbSbY-NsDNaYjElHX-nVn1lnM3JgxUVeYV0sEeqhYFWjSsUkuJOEQoKPRUDHNbZ7_34NwmypvhRlIa-6RqG4OaJvwfBT-DHJkd1iX0s--ooF8lxW_haoNpnlQ==> . And, read AdExchanger's May interview with Haskell here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014Q0dZdgTDMI01vQpUpqY5RCcPw2kKTwe4dsmhmOVTSVCOKUyUba8U2971p6Bcz_wi3rTfqWH6FQ04DyQOuw7Lcqr891_ICC9gkS5eoJE8xP1NJUNR70sBDbFljNSQqpPm1ajtnLoNBcmS56D9JSlhhvmg1rqj_MKrldl0QZFTaNKNnyfpZQnlvl7skztsN7FrYrP-yTlRLbfFaGlp1uXEqkerfCXS5U3> . Digital aches for TV's storytelling capability.

 

Gauging The Exchange

 

Facebook News Feed ads are more successful than right-hand side placements. We've heard this before, but now AdRoll has some data to back up the claim. In a study of 547 advertisers, the FBX retargeting company found "News Feed retargeting had a click-through rate (CTR) 49x higher than RHS (Right Hand Side campaigns) and 21x higher than standard Web retargeting" and "News Feed CPCs were ½ that of RHS campaigns and 1/5 of Web retargeting." Read the report here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014Q0dZdgTDMIfWpsi-7fvWzjX67cCq_k6NOTAwFAVgi_KgytsDFwldsXFHxQu6I0b88z3VJyTI0h9aI1yB-p_34Nj_gDf3Btls0F2dVaCVHKHLlbON7BAIzzB7HlqdKB6NbVpuCbusqMPExNC6iPUlg==> , or the blog post here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014Q0dZdgTDMIyO0msreSQWPKRsp1LEz9KYcxbdBYD4wG1boSqnz3tYV0rg-TZgRde5-QWrc-cut3EXpPP3XOlI1yO7Ra51RNM7u-iTtZc_0OY908Mvs5V8SzLs6T20xUxiISo8xgNzD8h2fyP4EYAKFN2WZzwM1EKkkPkxyUkP74=> .

 

Squaring Offline With Online

 

Square may have started as a mobile-transaction business, but its newest product puts it in direct competition with eBay. It's called Square Market and it allows merchants to create storefronts that are optimized for mobile, and it ties in to brick-and-mortar stores as well, according to Mobile Commerce Daily. "Square wants to take eBay/PayPal business with a much lower cost model, the same way warehouse clubs took business from retailers with everyday low price," said Steve Timpson, president of Siteminis. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014Q0dZdgTDMI9NTZxWcf9avyQks4CCdxUHUM1SZhlCq6-RSpqJNdBZSC2BlMaJtWL7Nj3aGQnDob-slcGFqd7xqPX1xbDTsK3h76ntjfq-Rqx5e1dBUT9XYZ7dGn29klgCovMRfItdXMExOyPJWr9CbOchtsEKcaAb9IB-QKn5YcB2PIoqTKZ1G3erREXXT5iIXnJiHAGQCVXkjgs3Vba0A==> . Square's media biz is just around the corner.

 

Native Ad News

 

Yahoo continues to make headlines as Marissa Mayer works on bringing the company back to the top of the market, this time by introducing more personalized news feeds. But as PaidContent's Jeff Roberts points out, Yahoo will also need to monetize the content. Patrick Albano, VP of sales for Yahoo, said, "As the Web becomes more relevant, our native ads will have to be even more relevant." Are native ads a moneymaker for Yahoo News? Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014Q0dZdgTDMJv1F9qnSeKI8iarR-W5dc6Z7_xIL-bGJeizce-hap7QtiSciS9x5gY8_cYMj71mtcgTJUH0HQV3EcE0H7_Ijnv33uGc3G-KrdBWAT-mN8qeFoV02dGJr_vH34QJFRtxLXu9RBMi5KoZAS8nLlqd1WnDNw-bcHvhobRptNkDCYpyB24MHDlTdSR8HaRmOK9FYSpuJJiWyf7c4pKSbrGscyA> .

 

Real-Time Hyperlocal (RTH?)

 

In a feature piece, Starcom MediaVest Group's Derek Thompson talked to Street Fight about the importance of hyperlocal advertising. "The ability to integrate third-party ad-serving is a critical component. And the ability to manage and optimize accounts in real time in terms of delivery, execution and results is also extremely important. Those are two things that I think are kind of the minimum requirements to get going," Thompson said. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014Q0dZdgTDMJK2S9bpK4dZEsec295Wxf6itmDGylpBTLYzd7bGGsS6zsqMGR2dJ3WTwWb8r56iVEn9BozsK56r-uuNXmOvB2EBqZdt01rUO66oSonGydwj__7KSgDYcGZ_-7jxI71nKVE5WrIJirEl8HLOTezqnSlY1uzYuE1Fibc9nluZzSNBrU7t2_Quvk2brHKeMBXruOIlfPlJ43iDz3i9sN-c5-RhJCR0mM-mz8=> .

Facebook's Got A New Policy

 

In an effort to ease brand safety fears, Facebook is implementing a new policy for which Facebook Pages and Groups are allowed to have ads on them. According to a blog post, the process will be manual to begin and eventually will be automated. The main focus will be keeping ads off pages that feature violence or explicit content. From the post: "While these changes won't have a meaningful impact on Facebook's business, they will result in benefits to people and marketers." Read the blog post here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0014Q0dZdgTDMIZCsCMIKW72xbNbXoyiOg8RWxXo5ez7tTb8yIEEGMeEmpgoCYylzDCJX6Xv2xpDPqo_DtIY0Ab5kU-fQnK_6NRuYp8HYyq_NzzuYEtwmwGFiV0cW_XiquSUKudlPueiSe7wLESy75t9oSqfh1VO_Zc1_wDWpkb1vNPTfwc7Uyy8leYP_BRJvcr> .
